channel.title: üè¢ University of Science and Technology of China on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Science and Technology of China on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Are We on the Right Way for Evaluating Large Vision-Language Models?
item.description: MMStar benchmark tackles flawed LVLMs evaluation by focusing on vision-critical samples, minimizing data leakage, and introducing new metrics for fair multi-modal gain assessment.

item.title: Breaking Long-Tailed Learning Bottlenecks: A Controllable Paradigm with Hypernetwork-Generated Diverse Experts
item.description: Controllable long-tailed learning achieved via hypernetwork-generated diverse experts, adapting to user preferences and distribution shifts.

item.title: Decompose, Analyze and Rethink: Solving Intricate Problems with Human-like Reasoning Cycle
item.description: DeAR: A novel framework lets LLMs solve complex problems with human-like iterative reasoning.

item.title: Differentiable Structure Learning with Partial Orders
item.description: This research introduces a novel plug-and-play module that efficiently integrates prior partial order constraints into differentiable structure learning, significantly improving structure recovery qua…

item.title: DN-4DGS: Denoised Deformable Network with Temporal-Spatial Aggregation for Dynamic Scene Rendering
item.description: DN-4DGS: Real-time dynamic scene rendering is revolutionized by a denoised deformable network with temporal-spatial aggregation, achieving state-of-the-art quality.

item.title: EgoChoir: Capturing 3D Human-Object Interaction Regions from Egocentric Views
item.description: EgoChoir: a novel framework harmonizes visual appearance, head motion, and 3D objects to accurately estimate 3D human contact and object affordance from egocentric videos, surpassing existing methods.

item.title: Enhancing Zero-Shot Vision Models by Label-Free Prompt Distribution Learning and Bias Correcting
item.description: Frolic: A label-free framework boosts zero-shot vision model accuracy by learning prompt distributions and correcting label bias, achieving state-of-the-art performance across multiple datasets.

item.title: Generalization Error Bounds for Two-stage Recommender Systems with Tree Structure
item.description: Two-stage recommender systems using tree structures achieve better generalization with more branches and harmonized training data distributions across stages.

item.title: Get Rid of Isolation: A Continuous Multi-task Spatio-Temporal Learning Framework
item.description: CMuST: a novel continuous multi-task spatiotemporal learning framework tackles urban data limitations by enabling cross-interactions and task-level cooperation for enhanced generalization and adaptabi…

item.title: Homology Consistency Constrained Efficient Tuning for Vision-Language Models
item.description: Constraining vision-language model tuning via persistent homology ensures consistent image-text alignment, improving few-shot learning and domain generalization.

item.title: How Control Information Influences Multilingual Text Image Generation and Editing?
item.description: TextGen enhances multilingual visual text generation and editing by optimizing control information using Fourier analysis and a two-stage framework, achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: Improving Generalization of Dynamic Graph Learning via Environment Prompt
item.description: EpoD, a novel dynamic graph learning model, significantly improves generalization via a self-prompted learning mechanism for environment inference and a structural causal model utilizing dynamic subgr…

item.title: Masked Pre-training Enables Universal Zero-shot Denoiser
item.description: Masked Pre-training empowers a universal, fast zero-shot image denoiser!

item.title: MILP-StuDio: MILP Instance Generation via Block Structure Decomposition
item.description: MILP-StuDio generates high-quality mixed-integer linear programming instances by preserving crucial block structures, significantly improving learning-based solver performance.

item.title: Neural Krylov Iteration for Accelerating Linear System Solving
item.description: Neural Krylov Iteration (NeurKItt) accelerates linear system solving by using a neural operator to predict invariant subspaces, drastically reducing iteration counts and computation time.

item.title: SocraticLM: Exploring Socratic Personalized Teaching with Large Language Models
item.description: SocraticLM achieves a Socratic teaching paradigm, surpassing GPT-4 by 12%, through a novel multi-agent training pipeline and a comprehensive evaluation system.

item.title: TabPedia: Towards Comprehensive Visual Table Understanding with Concept Synergy
item.description: TabPedia: a novel large vision-language model, achieves superior visual table understanding by seamlessly integrating diverse tasks via a concept synergy mechanism and a new benchmark.

item.title: Toward Dynamic Non-Line-of-Sight Imaging with Mamba Enforced Temporal Consistency
item.description: Dynamic NLOS imaging gets a speed boost! New ST-Mamba method leverages temporal consistency across frames for high-resolution video reconstruction, overcoming speed limitations of traditional methods.

item.title: Towards Accurate and Fair Cognitive Diagnosis via Monotonic Data Augmentation
item.description: CMCD framework tackles data sparsity in cognitive diagnosis by using monotonic data augmentation to improve accuracy and fairness of diagnostic results.

item.title: Towards Neuron Attributions in Multi-Modal Large Language Models
item.description: NAM: a novel neuron attribution method for MLLMs, revealing modality-specific semantic knowledge and enabling multi-modal knowledge editing.

item.title: Towards Next-Generation Logic Synthesis: A Scalable Neural Circuit Generation Framework
item.description: A novel regularized triangle-shaped neural network framework, T-Net, achieves highly accurate and scalable logic circuit generation, significantly outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Uncertainty-based Offline Variational Bayesian Reinforcement Learning for Robustness under Diverse Data Corruptions
item.description: TRACER, a novel robust offline RL algorithm, uses Bayesian inference to handle uncertainty from diverse data corruptions, significantly outperforming existing methods.
